src:
Nokia najela 350 inženirjev, ki naj bi pospešili razvoj 5G tehnologije

04 Nov 2019, 15:00


Proizvajalec telekomunikacijske opreme Nokia je letos samo na Finskem zaposlil več kot 350 inženirjev, ki razvijajo tehnologijo 5G, so povedali v tem visokotehnološkem podjetju.

Pri največjem rivalu švedskega Ericssona in kitajskega Huaweija so sporočili, da so zaradi investicij v raziskave in razvoj zmanjšali dobiček letošnjega in prihodnjega leta. Investicije se dotikajo predvsem napredne 5G opreme za poslovno omrežje. 
Za omenjeno skrbi več kot 350 inženirjev, od katerih jih samo 240 bdi nad razvojem mobilnega omrežja, velik delež pa nad razvojem t.i. sistema SoC, omrežja s čipi v integrirani shemi ključnih elementov za opremo 5G.
Tommi Uitto, vodja razvoja omrežja, je potrdil, da so najeli več strokovnjakov za omenjena področja dela v različnih mestih po Finskem. Izjavo so kasneje povzeli številni mediji po Evropi in svetu.
Signali o razvojni naravnanosti Nokie bodo bržkone dober znak za slabe rezultate, ki jih je podjetje poželo na borzi po objavi letnih rezultatov poslovanja podjetja. Delnice omenjenega tehnološkega podjetja so prejšnji teden izgubile približno 21 % ravno zaradi objave podatkov o zmanjšanem dobičku.
text:
Nokia has hired 350 engineers to accelerate the development of 5G technology

04 Nov 2019, 15:00


Nokia telecommunications equipment maker has hired more than 350 5G engineers in Finland this year alone, the high-tech company said.

The biggest rival between Sweden's Ericsson and China's Huawei have been reported to have cut profits this year and next due to investment in R&D. The investments mainly touch on advanced 5G business networking equipment.
More than 350 engineers are in charge of this, of which only 240 are watching over the development of the mobile network, and a large share is over the development of the so-called. of the SoC system, chip networks in an integrated 5G key element scheme.
Tommi Uitto, Head of Network Development, confirmed that they have hired more experts in the above areas of work in different cities across Finland. The statement was later summarized by numerous media across Europe and the world.
Nokia's developmental signals are likely to be a good sign of the company's poor performance after the company's annual results have been released. Shares of the said technology company lost about 21% last week precisely due to the release of reduced profit data.
